title: Film-Based Social Problem-Solving Competency Development Course for Adult Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic social issues and foundational counseling skills
context.additional_context: A process where students access mobile environments via personal devices to analyze film content and derive strategies for solving social issues, with formative assessments enabling real-time monitoring of learning outcomes

learning_goals: Learners can analyze social issues in films by connecting them to three or more theoretical frameworks.
Learners can propose two or more practical solutions applicable to real-world professional environments based on film case studies.
Learners can exchange meaningful feedback five or more times in film-based discussions with peers via mobile platforms.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
